ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 1049
ygData.msgSnippet: No, the Nybright sisters are still there.  The Inkies are in the next camp over ... From: Essam Khairullah  To:
ygData.messageBody:
No, the Nybright sisters are still there. The Inkies are in the next camp
over
----- Original Message -----
From: "Essam Khairullah" <olgwinn@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, July 14, 2000 8:52 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 1049


> Actually the Nybright sisters are no longer there. A high level group
troop
> of Dark Elves (including a priestess who's at least level 45) has taken
over
> the Nybright camp. A couple of us decided to try to take over the camp
> (level 50+ wizzie, myself, and a couple of 50+ tanks, including a pally I
> think) and had to evac. The guards were easy enough (at level 40 or so)
but
> when we tried to pull the named priestess or whatever, they started to
> respawn and she was healing herself, etc.
>
> Olgwinn Pendragun
> Bard of 40 Missed Notes
>
>
> > Date: Thu, 13 Jul 2000 18:28:39 -0000
> > From: "Jennifer McComb" <mccomb@...>
> >Subject: Re: Newbie bard leaves Kunark
> >
> >--- In eqbards@egroups.com, Elijah Meeker <emeeker@m...> wrote:
> > > I have found level 12 heaven.
> >
> >[snip]
> >
> >Another fun place is the Nybright sisters camp in Lesser Faydark,
> >near loc -800, +2500 (I think). If you gather a dull pearl necklace
> >from each sister and give it to the drunkard in kelethin, you get
> >more exp and some item that sells for around 1pp. The sisters drop a
> >lot of rusties and the occasional bronze weapon. I would go over
> >there whenever I was getting bored in Steamfont.
> >
> >Adagia, Wood Elf Bard of 13 Rythms, Druzzil Ro
>
